Package eHealth

Class AppointmentsDB

java.lang.Object
eHealth.DBController
eHealth.AppointmentsDB
public class AppointmentsDB
extends DBController
This class is used to create the appointments table, and provide operations for querying the appointments table.
Author:
marin

  • Constructor Details

    • AppointmentsDB

      public AppointmentsDB()

  • Method Details

    • createAppointmentsDBTable

      public void createAppointmentsDBTable()

      Creating the appointments table

      A query is executed, which creates the appointment table with all its attributes in the database.

    • insertIntoAppointmentsDBTable

      public void insertIntoAppointmentsDBTable​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String docfirstname, java.lang.String doclastname, java.lang.String docaddress, java.lang.String AppointmentDate, java.lang.String AppointmentTime, int reminder) throws java.sql.SQLException

      Inserting a row into the appointments table

      A row is inserted into the appointments table, with the attributes specified by the caller of this method.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the referenced user
      docfirstname - The first name of the referenced doctor
      doclastname - The last name of the referenced doctor
      docaddress - The address of the referenced doctor
      AppointmentDate - The specified date for the appointment
      AppointmentTime - The specified time for the appointment
      reminder - The reminder for the appointment (in min)
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - If row can not be inserted

    • updateAppointmentInDB

      public java.lang.Boolean updateAppointmentInDB​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String time)

    • deleteAppointmentFromDB

      public java.lang.Boolean deleteAppointmentFromDB​(int id)

      Deleting an appointment from the appointment table

      The appointment with the id specified by the caller of the method is deleted from the appointment table.
      Parameters:
      id - The Id which should be deleted
      Returns:
      true if deleted successfully, false if deletion failed

    • displayListOfAllDBEntries

      protected void displayListOfAllDBEntries​(java.lang.String tableName)
      Description copied from class: DBController

      Displaying all entries of a database table on the console

      This method uses the provided table name to display all its data on the console.
      Specified by:
      displayListOfAllDBEntries in class DBController
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the desired table
